precautions: Avoid fast-moving water and flooded basements.
Switch off electricity if water is entering the building (only if safe).
Keep phone charged and follow official alerts (NINA / Katwarn).
Move valuables and documents to higher floors.
trapped: Move to higher floors; avoid basements.
Call 112 if you cannot evacuate safely.
Signal for help (flashlight, phone light) and stay together.
Do not enter floodwater unless absolutely necessary.
injuries_yes: Call 112 for severe bleeding, unconsciousness, or breathing problems.
Apply pressure to bleeding wounds using a clean cloth.
Keep the injured person warm and calm.
Avoid moving someone with suspected spinal injuries unless necessary.
injuries_no: Prepare to evacuate if the situation worsens.

low: Stay alert and monitor updates for your area.
Prepare essentials in case conditions worsen.
medium: Consider moving to higher ground if water is rising.
Prepare to evacuate; pack medication and documents.
high: Evacuate if authorities advise it or water is rising quickly.
Call 112 if anyone is trapped or in danger.
Do not drive; use safe routes to higher ground.

ankle: Keep children away from water and check drains.
Wear waterproof boots and avoid open manholes.
knee: Do not drive through flooded roads.
Move to higher floors and prepare to evacuate.
waist: Evacuate to higher ground immediately if safe.
Call 112 if evacuation is unsafe or someone is trapped.
above: Life-threatening risk: move to the highest safe point and call 112.
